abstracts.cdata!:
The Second and Third Telecommunications
            Projects in Nepal was satisfactory. The International
            Development Association (IDA) must be commended for its
            significant contribution to the sector outside the two
            projects through its assistance and support to the Nepal
            Telecommunications Corporation (NTC) in resisting a proposal
            by a well known private telecommunications operating company
            for take over of international telecommunications operations
            in Nepal from NTC. The completion of both projects was
            substantially delayed by about four years. In general, the
            two projects achieved the basic objective of establishing an
            integrated modern telecommunications network in Nepal on
            which NTC could further develop adequate and efficient
            telecommunications services to meet the national needs, both
            for the "plain old telephone service" for the
            general public and enhanced voice and non voice services by
            its business and government customers.
